block.p: First, it was a victory for the recording industry. Then it was a defeat, when an appeals court granted a stay of the preliminary injunction issued a day earlier by a United States district judge that would have shut down Napster, the Internet music-swapping service that the major record labels have charged with contributing to widespread music piracy. Either way, as millions of Internet users stampeded to Napster and alternatives, the legal wrangling raised the question of whether enforcing copyright law in a digital age might take more than winning in court.
